Training

Here, we demonstrate the visualization and interactions we have provided in this evaluation tool.

In this study, we made the following assumptions:
  • The quality of the generated fiber tracts is not a part of this evaluation. Please accept this as a bundle and evaluate based on added uncertainty visualization.
  • We assume the tumors presented in this study are gliomas.

Previously, we have seen the variations in the fiber tract from only one seed-point. In practice, visualizing the variation of the whole bundle (multiple tracts) is more clinically relevant.
An interactive 3D view below shows the variations of the fiber bundle. In this case, three levels of variance are represented 25%, 75% , 100% . You can make the selection to see only the representative fibers (median) or the fibers from a single scan.

You can interact with the 3D view using mouse and use sliders to manipulate the anatomical slices. Distribution icons (on the top of the right column) can be clicked to select the variance levels, to visualize only the representative fibers or to view the single scan fibers.

Left Mouse button: Rotate
Scroll: Zoom in/out
